text: Paul Stroobants (26 April 1947 – 25 November 2024) was a Belgian three-cushion billiards player. He was two times world champion and won many other prizes at international tournaments. ==Biography== Stroobants became as a member of the Belgian natioan team two times world champion at the World Team Championships in 1990 and 1994. The team also won the silver medal in 1991. Next to that he won with the national team the . In 1990 and 1993 he won the bronze medal individually at the CEB European Three-cushion Championship.Heinrich Weingartner: Carambol, No 244, Wien, October 1989, page: 10–15 He also finished third at a Three-cushion Grand Prix in 1993.Heinrich Weingartner: Carambol, No 60, Wien, December 1993, page: 22–27SMV Sport-Media: CEB Report 1993/94, No 6, Bottrop, 1992, page: 52–57 He competed at many Three-Cushion World Cup events between 1986 and 1996. Stroobants became in 1989, 1990 and 1992. Stoobants was a member of Leuven Billiards Club Zanzibar for 68 years. He also served as the chairman for many years. After being ill for many years, Stroobants died in UZ Leuven on 25 November 2024, at the age of 77 years old. ==References== Category:Belgian sportspeople Category:1947 births Category:2024 deaths Category:People from Leuven
title: Paul Stroobants
